trans-unit.source: The <codeph>SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR</codeph> system procedure stores a jar file in a database.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR</codeph> system procedure stores a jar file in a database.

target.mrk: The <codeph>SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR</codeph> system procedure stores a jar file in a database.

trans-unit.source: SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR(IN JAR_FILE_PATH_OR_URL VARCHAR(32672), IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672), IN DEPLOY INTEGER)

seg-source.mrk: SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR(IN JAR_FILE_PATH_OR_URL VARCHAR(32672), IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672), IN DEPLOY INTEGER)

target.mrk: SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR(IN JAR_FILE_PATH_OR_URL VARCHAR(32672), IN QUALIFIED_JAR_NAME VARCHAR(32672), IN DEPLOY INTEGER)

trans-unit.source: The path or URL of the jar file to add. A path includes both the directory and the file name (unless the file is in the current directory, in which case the directory is optional). For example:

seg-source.mrk: The path or URL of the jar file to add.
A path includes both the directory and the file name (unless the file is in the current directory, in which case the directory is optional).

target.mrk: The path or URL of the jar file to add.
A path includes both the directory and the file name (unless the file is in the current directory, in which case the directory is optional).

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name. Two examples:

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> name of the jar file, qualified by the schema name.

trans-unit.source: If set to 1, indicates the existence of an SQLJ deployment descriptor file. <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> ignores this argument, so it is normally set to 0.

seg-source.mrk: If set to 1, indicates the existence of an SQLJ deployment descriptor file.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> ignores this argument, so it is normally set to 0.

target.mrk: If set to 1, indicates the existence of an SQLJ deployment descriptor file.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> ignores this argument, so it is normally set to 0.

trans-unit.source: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.

seg-source.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

target.mrk: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> has execute privileges on this procedure by default.
See "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.
The database owner can grant access to other users.

trans-unit.source: -- SQL statement -- install jar from current directory CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('tours.jar', 'APP.Sample1', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar using full path CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('c:\myjarfiles\tours.jar', 'APP.Sample1', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar from remote location CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('http://www.example.com/tours.jar', 'APP.Sample2', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar using a quoted identifier for the -- jar name CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('tours.jar', 'APP."Sample3"', 0)

seg-source.mrk: -- SQL statement -- install jar from current directory CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('tours.jar', 'APP.Sample1', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar using full path CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('c:\myjarfiles\tours.jar', 'APP.Sample1', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar from remote location CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('http://www.example.com/tours.jar', 'APP.Sample2', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar using a quoted identifier for the -- jar name CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('tours.jar', 'APP."Sample3"', 0)

target.mrk: -- SQL statement -- install jar from current directory CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('tours.jar', 'APP.Sample1', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar using full path CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('c:\myjarfiles\tours.jar', 'APP.Sample1', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar from remote location CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('http://www.example.com/tours.jar', 'APP.Sample2', 0) -- SQL statement -- install jar using a quoted identifier for the -- jar name CALL SQLJ.INSTALL_JAR('tours.jar', 'APP."Sample3"', 0)
